Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target

Interface ISyncDownloadConstraints

All Superinterfaces:
ISyncDataType
public interface ISyncDownloadConstraints extends ISyncDataType
Defines some download constraints on an asset.

Overview

This entity clusters download constraints, which are not very complicated. Because of its simplicity, it can be easily mapped into asset property space. It does not need to be kept as a separate instance.

These constrains need to be stored with the sync target. There is no need to read these values, as they are NOT compared to the values at Smint.io. Smint.io platform is the master source of these values and thus during synchronization these value are only being set and not retrieved.

Creation of new instances

Every instance is being created with ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncDownloadConstraints().

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ISyncDownloadConstraints
    setMaxDownloads(Integer maxDownloads)
    Sets the maximum amount of downloads of the related asset, that are allowed.
    ISyncDownloadConstraints
    setMaxReuses(Integer maxReuses)
    Sets the maximum amount of re-uses of the related asset, that are allowed.
    ISyncDownloadConstraints
    setMaxUsers(Integer maxUsers)
    Sets the maximum amount of users that are allowed to use the related asset.

  • Method Details

    • setMaxUsers

      ISyncDownloadConstraints setMaxUsers(Integer maxUsers)
      Sets the maximum amount of users that are allowed to use the related asset.

      The default value is 0 (meaning "unrestricted"), which is different from unknown. so if this function is never called on the implementing instance, null is the value to store on the sync target for the related asset as the constraint's value is simply not known.

      Parameters:
      maxUsers - the maximum amount of users as a positive integer value. if value is below or equal 0, then there are no restrictions on the maximum amount of users. Values below 0 should be stored as null, which means unknown.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setMaxDownloads

      ISyncDownloadConstraints setMaxDownloads(Integer maxDownloads)
      Sets the maximum amount of downloads of the related asset, that are allowed.

      The default value is 0 (meaning "unrestricted"), which is different from unknown. so if this function is never called on the implementing instance, null is the value to store on the sync target for the related asset as the constraint's value is simply not known.

      Parameters:
      maxDownloads - the maximum amount of downloads as a positive integer value. if value is below or equal 0, then there are no restrictions on the maximum downloads. Values below 0 should be stored as null, which means unknown.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setMaxReuses

      ISyncDownloadConstraints setMaxReuses(Integer maxReuses)
      Sets the maximum amount of re-uses of the related asset, that are allowed.

      The default value is 0 (meaning "unrestricted"), which is different from unknown. so if this function is never called on the implementing instance, null is the value to store on the sync target for the related asset as the constraint's value is simply not known.

      Parameters:
      maxReuses - the maximum re-uses as a positive integer value. if value is below or equal 0, then there are no restrictions on the maximum downloads. Values below 0 should be stored as null, which means unknown.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
